required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Massachusetts General Hospital and Tsuchiura Kyodo General Hospital Coronary Imaging Collaboration
clinical_study.official_title: Massachusetts General Hospital and Tsuchiura Kyodo General Hospital Coronary Imaging Collaboration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this collaboration is to establish a multi-modality image database including coronary angiograms, optical coherence tomography (OCT), computed tomography angiograms (CTA) and cardiac magnetic resonance imaging (CMR) for future studies. The main goal of this collaboration is to create a resource to promote further understanding of the pathobiology of atherosclerosis through image analysis.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this collaboration is to establish a multi-modality image database including coronary angiograms, optical coherence tomography (OCT), computed tomography angiograms (CTA) and cardiac magnetic resonance imaging (CMR) for future studies. About one thousand patients who underwent coronary angiography with OCT and had a CTA prior to catheterization at Tsuchiura Kyodo General Hospital (TKGH) in Japan, will be included. A subset of these patients also had CMR. The main goal of this collaboration is to create a resource to promote further understanding of the pathobiology of atherosclerosis through image analysis.

arm_group.description: Patients diagnosed with acute coronary syndrome.

intervention.intervention_name: Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT) and Computed Tomography Angiography (CTA)
intervention.description: Subjects underwent CTA, then OCT during cardiac catheterization as part of their standard clinical care.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects who underwent CTA prior to cardiac catheterization, and OCT during catheterization were included.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Had CTA prior to cardiac catheterization and then OCT during catheterization
Exclusion Criteria:
-

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor of Medicine, Harvard Medical School

patient_data.ipd_description: There is no plan to share IPD for this observational study.
